3: You board a reinforced defense ship and leaves the Red Tide with the Support Force's help.
Everyone wears protective gear and the ship itself has been reinforced, but the highly concentrated Punishing Virus still finds its way in and causes symptoms of infection in everyone.
After receiving first-aid, you all look over the abandoned area.
This place seems to have been an office area.
I thought a business area was the same as a business street.
They do sound very similar, but they're actually different. I've been here on several rescue missions... a business area has more people and Corrupted than a business street.
So it's like a factory, then? I focus so much on fighting that I never paid attention to their difference. I mean, they've both been destroyed beyond recognition, so...
But there is one thing I know about an industrial district.
We've reached a fork—the road splits into left and right. Which path are we taking?
I don't have enough clues to say much. They look the same.
I can't tell you why, but I think we should go right.
I think we should go left. It feels more peaceful.
We now have a rough idea where these paths lead. It's you call, Commandant.
It is quite obvious that the road on the left has fewer Corrupted. Most of them are crowding up on the right.
